title: WWE legend The Undertaker was seen having a cheeky Nando's in Scotland
text:
Graveyard Symphony intensifies (Picture: Getty)

WWE legend and apparently Piri Piri fan, The Undertaker, was spotted having a cheeky Nando’s in Scotland and we’re wondering if he settled for a lemon and herb.

The Undertaker, whose real name is Mark William Callaway, was spotted by a Twitter user undertaking his latest challenge of saucy chicken.

Twitter user Jack Passmore posted: ‘Birds in nandos n she goes to me there’s someone famous sitting next to me n it’s none other than the f***ing undertaker [sic],’ alongside a crying emoji.

There is a pattern of American celebrities visiting Nando’s and we need to know who told them to try it.

He probably told the waiter serving: ‘You can’t hide from The Deadman,’ and sat down to wait for his 30 mild wraps.

Mark was in Scotland to appear at a Comic Con event in Glasgow, where fans were charged a whopping £500 for a special meet and greet.

The icon will be returning to the WWE ring on 31 October – ooh, spooky – for a pay-per-view extravaganza in Saudi Arabia.

He was also due to appear on the Fox premiere of Smackdown in the beginning of the month but suddenly did not appear alongside hosts Goldberg and Hulk Hogan.

When asked why he didn’t appear, he said: ‘I was told I won’t be needed.’

Fans were quick to freak out when they realised the hilarity of the entire situation.

One user tweeted: ‘Imagine the disappointment when he goes for the Lemon and Herb sauce,’ along with a few crying emojis.

‘Breast in piece,’ another fan tweeted.

Meanwhile, the orginal poster’s girlfriend defended not knowing who The Undertaker was.

She said: ‘Mate how the f**k am I supposed to know who he is I’m no a wwe superfan [sic].’

‘He’s the deadman Sarah, one half of the brothers of destruction. Who wouldn’t know who he is,’ someone responded.

To be fair, if The Undertaker sat next to us in Nando’s, we’d think we’re hallucinating or about to get beat up.
